newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber closes mixed on Tokyo trend.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber closes mixed on Tokyo trend.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended mixed in tandem with trends in Tokyo after the domestic market completed another day without buying interest, said dealers.
They said there were no reports of sales and inquiries, the market followed the mixed values of futures in Tokyo.
At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quoted June RSS One buyer unchanged at 275.50 cents ($1.10) a kg. June SMR20 buyer was 1.50 cents lower at 257.50.
Traders offered the SMR CV at 331 cents, SMR L at 309 cents, SMR 5 at 268, SMR 10 at 254 and drum latex at 226 cents.
Dealers said supply of raw materials had tightened slightly due to rains in recent days, which had reduced the flow of latex into the market.

The INRO five-day moving indicator was, however, quoted higher at 208.06 Malaysian/Singaporean cents per kg on May 5, compared to the 208.05 on May 2. The daily indicator was at 208.64 from 208.57 previously.
